messages.message:
FYI, I updated the `ibdev-backend` template to support passthrough mode on the https endpoint. This means no more copying cookies!

To make a request from postman, you need to send the header  `X-My-App-Sec` with a value that matches the regex `.*it-works-tm.*`
Thanks Victor! I found the attribute in the yaml. Just adding a bit, need to manually hit the resync button for people with existing crafting sandbox :laughing:

i just resynced my sandbox to get these changes and now when i try to open up aihub through the https link (https://https--ayeshaali1-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/) all i get is black screen + "unauthenticated", happening for anyone else?
Interesting. Looks like it no longer goes directs to the login.
You should be able to manually login here: https://login.instabase.sandboxes.site/
Alright. I split the endpoint into two: https and api.
Are there security implications? The admin password for crafting sandboxes is weak. If we can bypass the additional crafting sso check, that is cause for concern.
Ideally, we'd gate access to these sandbxoes behind banyan.
However, we are not currently doing that:)
Yah. To actually do anything with the api endpoint, they'd need both an API key and the `X-My-App-Sec`  header. Not sure if that's enough.

Yeah, API is fine bc the auth tokens are randomly generated

 - what about webapp endpoints like /login?
I put `/api/` as a path prefix, so `/login` will just return a 404.
catching up on this thread -- i don't fully know the request flow -- should I be concerned about security?
